line.en: Alright, then.

I wasn't used to this type of thing at all. No
one had ever confessed their love to me before,
and I had no experience with communicating about
my feelings.
I didn't know what the right response was, but\nI'd prepared the response that felt right to\nme...
'What's up? Why did you call me out here?'
'Well, it's just... I have something to say to\nyou.'
I'd asked Yoru to meet me outside.
There was something I had to tell her.
'Although I've actually got a pretty good guess.'
That's right. The reason I'd called Yoru outside\nwas...
'... I'm sorry.'
... to apologize to her.
I had to tell Yoru exactly how I felt.
'... Well, I was pretty sure that was going to\nhappen.'
She didn't look sad or upset, but answered\nmatter-of-factly.
I guess all my concern for not hurting her\nfeelings had just been my own over-reaction.
'After all, you seem to have a bit of a Lolita\ncomplex.'
'I think my sister is much more your type. She's\nso good-tempered, unlike me. I'm too aloof.'
'I.. I don't have a Lolita complex or anything.\nAnyway, if that's what you think, you yourself\nare...'
'But I'm not very Lolita-like, am I? I'm not\ncute; I'm sharp. Psychologically, I'm not\ncompatible with the Lolita complex.'
Psychologically? What the heck?
'... Anyway, I knew it already...'
'Yoru...'
Yoru seemed to be looking somewhere far away.
I'm sure it's true that she'd already guessed.
Her eyes were clear, and seemed focused on\nsomething distant.
'But I'm glad. That you chose my sister.'
'I know I've already told you, but I really love\nmy sister.'
She smiled at me as she answered.
'So you don't need to apologize. You haven't done\nsomething wrong, have you?'
Yes, I'd done something wrong.
I hadn't noticed their feelings, and I'd played\nwith their hearts.
That was such a pathetic way for a guy to act, it\nhad to be wrong.
But...
But...
That's it.
At a time like this, this is what I should do.
'Thank you.'
I should be grateful for Yoru's feelings.
I should accept her kind response.
'Can I ask you just one thing?'
'Hmm?'
'Why did you choose my sister?'
Why had I chosen to accept Asa's love?
'... I guess I just couldn't leave her alone.'
'You mean you want to protect her?'
'Umm... I guess I want to look after her, or... I\ndon't know.'
'... Or do you pity her? Do you want to go out\nwith her because you think she's weak?'
'No, I don't think that. Actually, I think Asa's\nstrong.'
It's not that I think she's weak; I don't want to\ndate her to protect her.
It wasn't pity. Not that, but...
'She's not great at dealing with problems, and\nsometimes she's clumsy... And maybe she's not as\nimpressive as you are. But...'
'But because of that, seeing how she's fought to\novercome all sorts of things up to now, just\nbeing with her gives me confidence as well.'
'And I want to keep watching her. I don't really\nunderstand it all myself, but I want to be close\nto her.'
That's right, I want to be near her.
I want to be close to her, and see the world the\nway she sees it.
That's how I felt.
'It's just like what you said, Yoru... that Asa\nseems to give you something that you don't have\nwithin yourself.'
That's right.
Because Asa is the type of person that she is, I\nfeel that she gives me something important.
'Although, all of this is probably just my own\nrationalization.'
'I think I simply love her. I love Asa.'
I felt that was all there was to it, really.
No matter what, I just loved Asa.
'... I've changed my mind. I hate you.'
'Huh?'
'You've taken two important things away from me.'
'I, I'm sorry... Wait, two?'
'My sister, and my heart...'
'Well, I've already taken one of those back, and\nI don't intend to let you keep my sister to\nyourself, but...'
'Yoru...'
'And anyway, I already knew how all of this was\ngoing to turn out from the beginning.'
'Even if you'd told me you loved me, I don't\nthink I could have dated you, because I couldn't\nleave my sister on her own.'
'So even if you'd chosen me, I would have turned\nyou down.'
'So in other words, I haven't been turned down at\nall, have I?'
'What are you talking about?'
Yoru wasn't being very logical.
... But if that was the case... If she would have\nturned me down anyway...
If I thought about it that way, maybe I'd feel\nbetter?
Or maybe not.
But for some reason, what Yoru had to say made me\nfeel just a little relieved.
'A, anyway, that's how it is. If you don't have\nanything else to say, then hurry up and go back\ninside!'
'Huh?... Are you going back in?'
'I want to stay out here for a bit longer! Now go\ninside!'
'You have something to say to my sister too,\ndon't you?! If you go now, she should still be\nawake.'
'Ah... Uh, yeah. Okay.'
I did as Yoru said and turned to go back inside\nthe dormitory.
Oh, I get it. She's giving me time alone with\nAsa.
'... Thank you, Yoru.'
'Whatever, just go!'
'Aaahh...'
'Ungh...'
'... sniff... Why am I crying?'
'He could have thought about it just a little\nlonger, though... He made up his mind so quickly!\n... sniff...'
... Sigh...
It's hard to turn down someone's feelings for\nyou.
But thanks to Yoru acting tough, I felt a lot\nbetter.
Still feeling grateful to Yoru, I went to visit\nAsa.
'Yes?'
'It's me. Can I come in?'
'Ah... Y, yes!'
I took a deep breath.
'A, Aoi...'
Asa looked oddly restless as I entered the room.
Even though it was quite late, she wasn't wearing\nher pajamas yet, and she was sitting at her desk\ninstead of her bed.
It looked like she'd been reading a book.
'Ah, umm... Sorry about earlier.'
'N, no! That was my fault!'
Remembering the incident in the bathroom, I\nstarted fidgeting too.
'You're not going to bed yet?'
'I... I couldn't sleep, so I was actually just\nabout to head outside. Yoru went somewhere\nearlier and hasn't come back, either.'
'I thought she was with you, actually. Wasn't\nshe?'
'Oh, sorry. I was with her just a minute ago.\nSorry to keep her from you.'
'Ah, I see. That's what I thought.'
'Yeah. Sorry, I asked her to come meet me.'
Asa looked quiet and serious.
'Wh, What...'
It seemed like she wanted to ask something, but\ncouldn't quite make herself.
Each time she tried to speak, she seemed to\nswallow her own words.
'... To tell the truth, Yoru confessed to me\ntoday as well.'
'On the way home. When I told her I'd heard of\nyour feelings, she confessed to me too.'
'So I gave her my answer.'
'So, that's what was going on.'
'I... I see. Yoru told you...'
'Yoru liked you too, after all...'
Apparently Asa had suspected, but hadn't asked\nYoru directly about her feelings.
She must have just guessed. Almost positive, but\nstill a guess.
And she'd been worried, and unsure what to do.
And then... She kissed me.
'What's wrong with me?'
'Yesterday, and today too. I've just been\nworrying you, and causing problems for everyone\nwith my selfishness...'
'Even my catching a cold was probably because of\nmy problems with my feelings.'
'It was hard for me to face you and Yoru, so I\ndidn't want to go to the club... So...'
It's easy for people to get sick when they're\nfeeling depressed.
Asa was trying to explain that was what happened\nto her.
And it seemed to be the truth.
'So I know the answer, even without you telling\nme.'

'It's the same with Soaring as with a
relationship. I don't know whether I really love
anything. I think maybe I just wanted something
to depend on.'
'It's because I'm like that... That you...'
Asa felt insecure.

She was even starting to doubt her own point of
view, having trouble understanding her own
feelings, overthinking everything, and
misinterpreting things.
So I had to help her clear up those\nmisunderstandings.
'You know what, Asa? I don't think you've noticed\nit yourself, but you're strong.'
'Huh?'
'Yoru said that too.'
'Even with all those worries you have, you still\nkeep moving forward, one step at a time.'
'Everyone has worries and things that block their\nway. But we try our best and keep going forward.'
'I'm the same way.'
'I told you that I came to this town last year,\nright?'
'I lived here a long time ago, but then my family\nmoved to another town, and we left this place.'
'Yes... You told me.'
'When I was a kid, this town, and the scenery\nhere, and more than anything, my friends, were so\nimportant to me...'
'Right after we moved, I was in so much shock\nfrom leaving everything I loved behind, that I\ngot really depressed.'
'I felt like I'd lost my whole world.'
'You did...? Just because... you moved?'
'Yeah. You know how as a kid, distances seem so\nmuch longer? I think it's probably because kids'\nlegs are so short.'
Even if their legs are physically the same\nlength, the footstep of a child and the footstep\nof an adult feel different.
To a child, just a few kilometers away feels like\nan adventure to another world.
'Since we moved so far away, it felt like we\nreally had gone to another world.'
When you leave someone once, it's easy to think\nthat you'll never seem them again.
And at the time, I really thought that.
'So when we moved, I thought I'd moved to a\ndifferent world from Ageha and the others...'
'I got carried away thinking that I'd lost my\ndearest friends and my hometown all at once.'
'And I wanted something to distract me from that\nloneliness. I needed something to help me\nescape.'
'I wanted to erase my sadness and replace it with\nsomething new.'
'And so I got hooked on riding the bicycle that\nAn-chan gave me when I moved. I threw myself into\nit completely.'
'So that's what got you started...'
That's right. It all began as a way to escape.
But as I kept it up, I began to love cycling for\nitself.
'When you're riding a bike, distances feel\nshorter, right?'
'I even thought that if I got really good at it,\nI could ride all the way back to this town\nagain.'
'I became totally engrossed in my bicycle, which\neven helped me cling to that ridiculous dream.'
'I'm a pretty simple guy, so once I get into\nsomething, I just keep doing it.'
'So I just rode as much as I could, and even\nstarted doing well in races...'
And then...
'And then... I lost something important to me\nonce again. I injured my leg in an accident.'
It was the second time I lost something so\nprecious.
It made me think that the whole world was against\nme, and I just stopped caring about anything.
I thought if there was a god out there somewhere,\nI'd like to kill him with a rock.
'I didn't know how to deal with my emotions, and\nI just kept getting more and more depressed.'
'It was like a disease without a cure. Over and\nover again, I lay in bed whispering to myself...\n'Why does this always happen to me?''
'I struggled so hard with that anguish. So I can\nunderstand your unhappy feelings a little.'
I didn't know just how dark Asa's feelings were,\nbut...
But in my own way, I understood, just a little.
'I was just tired out by everything. But then I\nfound a new dream. It was...'
'... Soaring?'
'Yes. I came back to this town, and the sight of\nthe glider whirling through the sky comforted\nme.'
'In a way, it's probably another way to escape.\nTo escape from my failures and losses and\nanxieties.'
'But actually I think that's okay. Sometimes it's\nnecessary to worry and to run away.'
'Sometimes that's what it takes to move forward\nagain.'
We were surrounded by amazing people like Yoru.
Surrounded by people who never seemed to get\nscared, to run away, or even to worry, it could\nbe easy to think that was the only way to live.
But I was sure that wasn't the case.
There are always plenty of people who feel close\nto stumbling every time they walk.
So I didn't think it was at all strange to run\naway or worry.
'I turned her down.'
'Huh?'
'I told Yoru I was sorry. I couldn't return her\nfeelings.'
'Wh, why...?'
'Because I love you, Asa.'

Asa constantly worried about those things, but
still tried to face her problems face-on, even
when it hurt. She was always too serious, too
earnest. And I loved her for it.
I'd fallen in love.
'I thought really hard about it. But... I guess\nthis is just how I feel.'
'But... But Yoru is so much more incredible than\nme!'
'I don't care if someone is incredible or not.\nThe one I love is you, Asa.'
'... R-Really? ... Is it really true?'
That's right. It didn't matter.
Things like that just didn't matter.
'Really.'
'You're not lying? You're not just saying this\nout of pity?'
'No. I really mean it. I love you, Asa.'
'But you said... that I was like a little sister\nto you...'
'So? Is there a rule that says I can't fall in\nlove with someone who feels like a sister to me?'
'But that's not the type of thing you say to your\ngirlfriend! It's just... It's just not normal!'
'Well, from now on, it's exactly the type of\nthing I'd say to my girlfriend.'
'I love you, Asa.'
I tried to say it nonchalantly, but it sounded\nreally cheesy that time.
It felt like I'd said something completely\noutrageous.
'Asa?'
'I, I like you too. I told you once already, but\nI love you!'
'When I'm with you, my chest feels all filled up,\nso much it hurts. But that pain feels good\nsomehow...'
Asa started to cry.
'Wh, Why are you crying?'
'I'm happy. Because you said... you love me... So\nI'm so happy...!'
Heavy tears fell from Asa's eyes.
When I saw her like that, I couldn't help but\nthink that she was every bit as cute as I'd\nthought.
I took a step towards her...
... and hugged her.
I wrapped both of my arms gently around her.
'I, I'm not really used to stuff like this. I\njust thought this might be the right thing to\ndo.'
'... Th, that's right. I... I've never cried\ntears of joy... Before now.'
'Uurrmmm... Waaah!'
Wrapped in my arms, Asa startled bawling.
'Hey, Sis.'
'... What is it, Yoru?'
'What made you fall for Aoi?'
'... That's hard to answer.'
'I still don't understand myself. By the time I\nnoticed, I was already in love with him. I guess\nthat's just how love works.'
'I think it was the same for me.'
'Huh?'

'I mean, he's kind, and dependable, and any
number of things if I really look for an
answer... But more than that, it was just like,
Pow! I loved him.'
'It's like my feelings for the sky. It just\nhappened somehow.'
'... I see.'
'Yeah.'
'Sis, I'm just a little bit mad.'
'Huh?'
'Well, you confessed to him while pretending to\nbe me, without my permission. It's only natural\nfor me to be angry.'
'Ah... That. I'm sorry...'
'But actually, I'm happy. You still managed to\ntell him how we felt, honestly and directly.'
'Regardless of how it happened, or under what\ncircumstances, you were still able to tell him,\nand to have your own feelings recognized.'
'I'll be happy for you if things go well.'
'But, I'm just a bit frustrated.'
'It's the first time I've ever lost to you in a\ncompetition.'
'... That's right. It's the first time.'
'I've got a question for you, Sis!'
'What is it?'
'Tell me 10 good things about Aoi.'
'Huh?! Wha?! What do you mean...?'
'Well, you beat me and won his heart, right? So\nyou should be able to list plenty of great things\nabout him.'

'I don't want to hear you waffling over your
decision about him in the future, so in order to
preempt that, I want you to start talking about
him right now!'
'Eh? Whaaaa?! Isn't this a bit sudden?!'
'Just do it. You beat me, right? This is the\nleast you can do for me.'
'Eeeeeh?! Yoru, are you angry?!'
'One minute has passed already. You've got 30\nseconds left... 20...'
'Why is this like shogi all of the sudden?! Wait\na second!'
'Whaaaaaa...?!'
... Flying, like sliding through the sky. That\nsight was what started our quest to build a\nglider.
But at some point, our vision lowered from the\nsky to the friends around us, and another story,\napart from gliders, began.
It was an accident. But once it was done, we\ncould see that it was a happy one.
During the first few days of summer vacation, we\nall concentrated on building the glider, making\nup for lost time.

Every now and then, Asa and Yoru were a little
awkward around each other, but for the most part
they'd returned to being close and affectionate
sisters.
And we...
I could hear a voice.
A voice calling me.
Ummm... Why was somebody... calling for me again?
Let's see...
'Aoi!'
Huh...?
'I see you finally woke up. It's time for\nbreakfast.'
'Huh?'
Time for breakfast?
Breakfast... That's my job to make... Right?
That time already? What's going on?
In a panic, I looked at my clock.
... Aaaaaaaaaaaaah!
'I, I've gotta hurry and make it!'
It wasn't just time to make breakfast, it was\nalready around the time we should be eating it.
And today we had to go to school. Every one of us\nhad plans to go to school.
... Wh, what sort of menu could I prepare now and\nstill get ready on time?
I already set the rice cooker last night, so if I\njust made some instant miso soup and got some\ntofu or natto or something out of the fridge...
'Ah, you don't need to panic, Aoi!'
'Huh?'
'I already made breakfast! Hee hee!'
'Already made it... You did?'
'Yes! You were so fast asleep and showed no signs\nof waking up, so I went ahead and got it ready\nfor you.'
'I... I see. You woke up that early, Asa?'
'Well, we're supposed to be dating now, right? So\nI... I wanted to wake you!'
'I... I'd always wanted to do stuff like that...'
So that was it.
That type of thing sent my heart soaring.
'W, was I a bother to you?'
'... No. Not at all.'
In fact, I was so happy that my chest felt like\nit was going to burst.
It felt like happiness and embarrassment were\nfighting for space inside me, and both of them\nwere knocking on my heart.
'So anyway, you can take your time getting\ndressed and coming downstairs. I'll start setting\nup the table now.'
'Th, thank you...'
What a wonderful girlfriend...
I must be the happiest boyfriend in the whole\nworld.
'What a wonderful morning. I won't be mourning my\ndecision to date her.'
Wow, that pun was awful. Apparently when I'm this\nhappy my brain goes all weird.
Anyway, it was time to get dressed.
'You're laaate, Aoi.'
'Sorry, I overslept a bit.'
When I went downstairs, everyone was already\ngathered at the table.
Asa had just laid out the food.
Puffs of steam floated up from the bowls of rice\nand miso soup, which must have been served only\nmoments ago.
There were potatoes and spinach in the miso soup,\nand a side dish of spinach, sesame, and fish\ncakes.

Bits of chili pepper were visible in the side
dish, which looked a bit spicy to eat first thing
in the morning... But that must be how Asa liked
it.
'Asa did her best. The miso soup looks really\ndelicious!'
'Oh, you're still here, Ageha?'
'Well, we're going to school today, right? I\nthought we may as well all go together.'
'But then you overslept and didn't even make\nbreakfast.'
'Well, it's not my job to make breakfast for you,\nanyway.'
'Hmph.'
'It's not like you to oversleep, Aoi. What\nhappened?'
'Well, a lot has been going on lately.'
'A lot?'
'Yeah. Umm... Yeah, a lot.'
I struggled to cover up my slip of the tongue.\nThat was close.
This could be a difficult situation to explain. I\ndidn't want to risk phrasing it poorly.
'Aoi and my sister have started dating.'
Oh dear.
'Yo, Yoru?!'
Still helping Asa with the breakfast, Yoru\ncasually let out that catastrophic statement.
'And apparently a lot happened yesterday. So he's\ntired, you see?'
'Eeeeeeeeeeeeh?!'
'R, really?! Aoi?!'
'Uh, umm... Well...'
'Spit it out, Aoi!'
'Well, err...'
I looked at Asa.
She was clearly panicking.
'Hee hee! So that's it! I see! That's what's\ngoing on!'
'That is what's going on.'
'Wa, wait a minute. How could you start dating\nsomeone without talking it over with me first,\nAoi?! That's not right!'
'Why should I need your permission, Ageha?'
'Even though we're friends, you didn't talk to me\nabout it at all... (mumble, mumble)'
'You too, Kotori?!'
Aaah, crap. Now what was I supposed to do?
'Looks rough, Aoi.'
'This is your fault, Yoru!'
'This is what you get for making me cry.'
'Huh? Aoi, did you make Yoru cry?'
'No, I mean, uh...'
Oh, man.
It's true that I made her cry, but... But...!
Aaah, she's enjoying this bit of revenge.
'So you say a lot happened yesterday and you\ndidn't get enough sleep, right, Aoi? What were\nyou up to?'
'You, you didn't...'
'Eh, huh? Aoi, is that what you did?!'
'I don't even know what's going on, but no,\nyou're all wrong! Right, Asa?!'
Her reaction was probably going to make them\nmisunderstand even more!
'Now that you mention it, the bed was in pretty\nbad condition this morning. You should reinforce\nthe legs.'
'You've already got everyone confused; there's no\nneed to mislead them even more!!'
'Come on, Yoru!'
'You move pretty fast, don't you, Aoi?'
'Aoi's climbed up the stairway to adulthood...'
'No, I haven't!!'
Ageha and Kotori kept teasing Asa and me\nthroughout the entire breakfast.
They kept asking how long we'd liked each other,\nand who admitted it first, and things like that.
'Hahaha, today started out pretty rough, huh...'
'... Seriously.'
Thanks to all that, I was exhausted before we\neven reached the school.
I was already tired out, and it was still early\nin the morning.
'I'm sorry. I never thought Yoru would say\nsomething like that. Ugh.'
'No, you don't need to apologize, Asa. Yoru's the\none...'
Aw, man, she said all those things about being\nalright, but she was really holding this against\nme, wasn't she?
But, maybe she was doing this for my sake.
This was probably her way of helping me out.\nMaking me feel like I didn't have to tiptoe\naround her.

Everyone would have found out about me and Asa
sooner or later, and I suppose this was as good
an opportunity as any to let everyone know at
once.
... I'd try to think of it that way, at least.
'Actually Yoru and I talked a lot last night.'
'About what?'
'Mostly about you.'
'Really? What did you say?'
'It's a secret.'
'If you aren't gonna tell me, don't bring it up\nin the first place... Now I'll worry about it.'
'A secret's still a secret.'
This vague conversation was making me\nuncomfortable.
But I guess it's a good thing.
It seemed that Asa and Yoru had made up again.
'What's this? Are you lovey-doving from the\nmoment you get to school?'
'We're not lovey-doving... What does lovey-doving\neven mean, anyway?'
'It's a word I thought up. It's the verb form of\n'lovey-dovey.''
I'm not even sure 'lovey-dovey' is a real word,\nactually...
'So, I didn't catch it earlier, but how did you\nmake Yoru cry, anyway?'
'Huh? Umm, well...'
Come on, Kotori. Just let that conversation go\nalready.
'Well, various things happened.'
'It's those things I wanna hear about.'
'Just various things. Ask Aoi about it.'
Whaa?!
'Aoi, what does she mean by 'various things'?'
'... Various things.'
'Why won't you tell me?'
'It's not something I really feel the need to\ntell you about.'
... And with that, the big hubbub finally settled\ndown for a bit.
And my new life with Asa, as boyfriend and\ngirlfriend, began.
'Hey! It's been a while, Aoi!'
When we entered the classroom, one guy came\nrunning over, looking happy to see us.
'... It hasn't really been that long, you know.\nYou saw me when we went swimming recently,\nright?'
'That day didn't go at all as planned, thanks to\nyou guys... I was afraid Akari might start hating\nme...'
'No, you brought that on yourself.'
That wasn't my fault... I think.

That day, Ma-bou had been caught secretly taking
pictures, and Kotori and the others had reported
him to Akari, telling the whole story from
beginning to end.
It was a pretty cruel punishment, given that he'd\nbegged them on hands and knees not to tell Akari.
Naturally I enjoyed watching all of this.
'I had to do a ton of errands for the student\ncouncil, too. I hardly had any vacation at\nall...'
Poor Ma-bou.
'What is it, Kotori?'
'Oh, I was just thinking, since we've come back\nafter a while, that the classroom smells really\nnice.'

'It's like... like the smell of a bunch of
different things and a bunch of different people,
all mixed together... or something. Anyway, it's
a good smell.'
'That sounds a little bit perverted.'
'I'm not a pervert.'
'But hearing you say something positive about\ncoming to school sure reminds me how much time\nhas passed.'
'That, and Aoi's got a girlfriend now.'
Kotori spoke so casually.
Of course Ma-bou didn't know about that yet,\nso...
'Huh?! Aoi, you got a girlfriend?!'
He was surprised.
'Uh... Ah, ummm, well...'
'It's Asa, from Soaring Club.'
'Whaaaaaaa?! I'd noticed that you two looked\npretty friendly lately, but...'
'Well, that's what's up.'
There was no point in hiding it, so I just told\nhim.
Though there was no real reason to tell him\neither, so I hadn't wanted to bring it up.
'I, I see. Well then. At any rate,\ncongratulations, Aoi!'
'Yeah, thanks.'
'Huh. Wow. Aoi's got a girlfriend, huh...?'
'... A girlfriend... Wow...'
'Ma-bou?'
'Hey! I'm sure you all want to catch up with each\nother, but now it's time to start homeroom, so\nplease go to your seats!'
Our teacher came into the room.
'Okay, the teacher's here. Back to your seat,\nMa-bou!'
'What is it?'
'No, nothing. Good luck.'
'What was that about?'
'I wonder.'
There were no classes on the first day of school,\nand all we had to do was listen to some\nannouncements and greet each other.

We had an all-school assembly, an all-grade
assembly, and then a few short discussions about
career plans and school events, and then we were
dismissed.
The longest part of the whole day was probably\nthe principal's pointless speech in the gym.
But still, listening to other people lecture for\nhalf a day was pretty tiring, and by the time\nhomeroom ended again I felt dull and heavy.
'Ugh, that was exhausting.'
'School really is tiring, isn't it? I can't\nbelieve I dealt with this every day.'
'No kidding. I really don't care what this school\nwas like in the past.'
Kotori seemed to seriously resent the principal's\nspeech.
'Yeah, but it's over now. Come on, it's time for\nclubs; that'll be fun, right?'
'That's right. It's like I managed to crawl out\nof hell. Okay, I'll do my best to enjoy club time\ntoday!'
Kotori stretched as she spoke.
'Aoi, you're gonna go pick up Asa on the way,\nright?'
'Yeah, I thought I'd go meet her. I was planning\nto eat lunch together first too. Wanna join us?'
'No thanks. A couple should enjoy themselves\nalone together. And besides, I'm already booked\ntoday.'
'... Already booked?'
'Yup. I've already made plans for lunch. Kotori\nand I will be eating there.'
'That's right. We girls with no boyfriends are\ngonna go to Windy's and compliment each other\nuntil it's time to go...'
'Well you don't have to put it that way.'
'So anyway, see ya!'
'See you later, Aoi.'
They left together.
'They really don't have to tease me quite that\nmuch.'
Oh well... I should go meet Asa.
Yoru would probably be there too, so I should\nprobably invite her to lunch as well.

She might not want to, considering what had
happened before, but if that was the case, I was
sure Yoru would have no problem telling me
directly.
'Ah, Aoi.'
I hesitated a moment, but it seemed to be okay,\nso I walked into her classroom.
Pretending I was already used to it, I walked up\nto Asa's desk and invited her out.
'I came to meet you... But, wait a minute...\nWhere's Yoru?'
'Actually, they just came and took her with\nthem.'
'They... You mean Kotori and Ageha?'
'That's right. Kotori, Ageha, and Kanako all came\nand invited Yoru out to lunch.'
'I'm pretty sure they were trying to be nice to\nus...'
They really didn't need to go that far...
This almost seemed to go further than teasing. It\nalmost felt like we were being left out. I felt\njust a little lonely.
'A, anyway, let's go.'
'R, Right...'
Aah, but actually, Kanako may have been looking\nout for Yoru's feelings more than ours.
It might have been uncomfortable for Yoru to be\ninvited to eat with me and Asa, or to be with us\ntoo much at all right now.
I realized that there were a lot of really kind\npeople in my life. I was grateful.
'So what should we do now? I thought maybe we\ncould eat lunch and then head to club together,\nbut...'
I'd been so rushed in the morning that I hadn't\nprepared any lunches or anything.
'A, Actually... I have food.'
'Huh?'
'This morning, I made lunch... Enough for you and\nme. I'm sorry I used the ingredients without\npermission...'
'Wow, really?'
'Yes. So, would you like to eat together? I'm not\nsure if you'll like it or not, but...'
'I'd love to! Thanks!'
'Well, then let's go eat on Windmill Hill! The\nview's great there! We might get our clothes a\nlittle dirty though!'
'Sounds good to me. Let's go!'
'Alright!'
So we headed to the usual hill.
'Hm? What is it, Asa?'
Asa kept reaching out her hand and then pulling\nit back, over and over again.
'Wha?! Uh, ummmm, it's nothing. Nothing at all!\nI'm fine!'
'Huh?'
'D, don't worry about it!'
I couldn't help but worry about it.
Reaching her hand out, and pulling it back?
Reaching, retreating.
'Give me your hand.'
'... Huh? Eeeehhh?!'
I took Asa's hand and held it.
'Is... is this alright?'
'Y, yes. I figured that since we're dating now,\nmaybe we could at least hold hands.'
'Thank goodness. If I'd guessed wrong that would\nhave been really embarrassing.'
'N, no, you were right; it's fine.'
Asa's hand squeezed mine back in response.
It was just as warm and as soft as I'd imagined.
'Your hands are big...'
'Yours are small and cute.'
'Hee hee! But having short fingers is kind of\ninconvenient, you know. They say that short\nfingers are a sign of clumsiness too...'
'Is... Is that so?'
The conversation grew awkward. I was getting\nuncharacteristically nervous.
I could feel my heartbeat growing faster out of\nnervousness.
'Um, er, isn't my hand getting sweaty? If it's\ngross, you can let go.'
'N, no, it's fine. It's me... S, sorry I'm so\nnervous.'
'No, no, I'm the one... I'm also kinda\nnervous...'
Suddenly both of us grew silent.
I just couldn't come up with anything to say.
My brain struggled to come up with some kind of\nconversation about holding hands, but I couldn't\nthink of anything.
What should I say?
I need to talk... or this will get...\nuncomfortable.
As I was worrying, Asa spoke up.
'Wh, what?'
'This is... kind of embarrassing, isn't it?'
And said just what I'd been thinking.
Yes. It was definitely embarrassing.
'...Should we stop?'
'No, it's fine just like this...'
'...Okay.'
As we tried to fight off the awkwardness, we\narrived at our destination.
'We... We're here.'
'Y, yeah.'
'Um, Aoi? Could you let go of my hand, please? I\nneed to get the lunches out of my bag.'
'Huh? Oh, aaah! Yes! Sorry, I was holding on too\ntight!'
I hurriedly let go of her hand.
Why was I still holding it anyway?!
'No, no, I'm sorry I didn't explain my plans\nbetter!'
'I, I'll get the lunches now!'
'Y, yeah!'
With her freed hands, Asa groped around in her\nbag to take out what looked like a boxed lunch,\nwrapped in a cloth.
'I... I hope you like it...'
'Wow, it looks great!'
The huge lunchbox opened to reveal an amazing\nlineup of colorful and delicious looking food. I\ncouldn't believe she'd made it in a hurry.
There were cherry tomatoes, omelets, fried\nchicken, deep-fried shrimp ,and sausages cut into\noctopus shapes.
There was boiled broccoli and a root vegetable\ndish spotted with many spicy peppers.
The rice was covered with a layer of ground\nchicken, as well as thinly sliced peppers.
'There was a ton of food.'
'Yes, I did my best. Ah, the peppers and the\nvegetables might be kind of spicy, so please be\ncareful.'
'I made it a little too much to my own taste...'
'Ahaha, that's just like you, Asa. I'll have\nsome.'
First I tried the chicken and rice.
The sweet soy sauce flavoring on the chicken\nspread out in my mouth.
It was a bit salty, but it went well with the\nunseasoned rice.
'If... If you were going to grade it, how many\npoints would I get...?'
'I'd say this was worth 100 percent.'
'R, really?!'
The ground chicken was tasty even when cold, and\nperfect for a boxed lunch.
I was impressed not only by Asa's cooking, but by\nthe fact that she chose that dish in the first\nplace.
And the strong, spicy peppers on top matched that\nflavor very well. They were delicious.
'...Yeah. The other dishes are good too.'
'Th, thank goodness! This was the first time I'd\never made a whole lunch by myself, so I was so\nworried I'd make a mistake...'
'Really? You tried hard, didn't you, Asa?'
'Y, yes. I tried as hard as I could.'
I could believe that until recently, she hadn't\neven been able to remember the very basics of\ncooking.
'There's a lot of food, but you can eat it all if\nyou want. I made a smaller lunch for myself.'
'R, really? I'll try.'
It was too much for me to eat by myself.
There was tons of rice packed in the box, in\naddition to all the side dishes. If I ate it all,\nI wouldn't be able to move...
'What is it, Asa?'
'No, I just think... Did I forget my own lunch?'
'Oh no... I can't believe I left it behind...\nEven though I managed to cook alright!'
'...Then why don't you eat mine with me?'
'Oh, but that's all for you...'
'Ahaha. I already thought it was too much for me\nto eat alone. I'd actually really appreciate it\nif you helped me finish it.'
'B, but... There's only one set of chopsticks...'
Oh, right.
Naturally there was only one set of chopsticks\nattached to this lunchbox.

'Um, then, I'll run to the convenience store and
buy something small, and ask for a pair of
chopsticks with it, and then come back. Wait here
a minute!'
'W, wait, Aoi.'
'Huh? Wh, what?'
'It's... It's okay. Let's eat together.'
'We can share that pair of chopsticks.'
As she spoke, Asa's face flushed deep red.
Um, in other words, she wanted to eat this lunch\ntogether with these?
A boy and a girl, eating a boxed lunch together\nwith one pair of chopsticks...
'Is... Is it a problem?'
'N, no, it's not a problem. But, are you sure,\nAsa?'
'If you don't mind...'
'No, I don't... mind or anything...'
There was no particular reason to object.
'Um, okay then! Can I use the chopsticks,\nplease?'
Asa took the chopsticks I'd been using.
And then...
'Okay, A.. Aoi... Here's some fried chicken. Say\n'Aaah'...'
Wow... This was intense.
My reaction was so mixed, it was difficult to\ndescribe.
'...Chomp'
'H, how is it?'
'D, delicious...'
'Really? G, good...'
I was happy but embarrassed, so embarrassed I\nfelt like I could die, but just as happy at the\nsame time...
It was hard to explain, but something like that.
'W...well then, this time I'll help you...'
'N...no, I'm okay. I'll feed myself.'
'No no, then I'm the only embarrassed one. You've\ngot to do it too.'
'No, I won't. I can't do it. I can feed you, but\nI can't be fed by someone else!'
'I can't let that slide, Asa. You can't make me\ndo it and then refuse to do it yourself. I was so\nembarrassed just now I thought I'd die.'
'C...can't you forgive me?'
'Nope! Here, hand me the chopsticks.'
'Alright, Aoi. Here's a sausage. Open up!'
'Hey! Don't just change the subject!'
Asa was just trying to move on as she pleased.
'There's dessert, too. I brought it in a separate\ncontainer.'
'Hey! Just give me the chopsticks!'
'Aaaah, Aoi, please, give me a breeeeeak!!'
'No! Come on, Asa, say 'Aaah'...'
'Uugh... Ah, aaah...'
And so the two of us became a couple.

The two of us were so close, already living in
the same place and belonging to the same club,
that we probably grew closer even faster than
most couples.

Now that I thought about it, we'd already kissed
before we even started dating. And although our
rooms were separate, we were already living
together.
We'd made it past several milestones before we'd\neven started.
And in the midst of all that, we were about to\nreach another big milestone with Soaring Club -\nthe last one before the final phase: 'flight.
'At this rate, it'll be done tomorrow.'
'Ooooh!'
The two of them sounded excited.
We'd been working so long to improve the glider,\nand it was finally going to be finished.
The wings and tail were remade, and now all that\nwas left was to adjust the body.
'It's been a long road so far...'
'A lot of stuff has happened, but we've finally\nmade it!'
'And that slope we started climbing... That long\nroad... Let's keep believing that it will lead us\nbeyond the sky... to the future!'
'Be sure to look forward to Habane-sensei's next\ncreation!'
'Sigh... Why are you acting like the club is all\nover? The important part starts now.'
That's right. The important part was about to\nstart. The remodelling was just a prelude to\nflight.
We needed to use this to fly, and to reach what\nwe hadn't reached last year.
'...Morning Glory.'
The reason this club had been founded... the\nmysterious passage in the clouds.
The sky that a girl named Isuka had been aiming\nfor.
'But the one we made this year is supposed to\nreach it, right? So we don't really have anything\nto worry about, do we?'
'There's absolutely no guarantee. All I can say\nis that we have a higher chance of reaching it\nthan last year.'

'Of course there's a possibility that we've made
a miscalculation in the designs of this glider,
or if we aren't lucky we may not be able to catch
the right wind on the day it flies.'
'In other words, we're just doing all we can.'
'Exactly.'
It was true. There was no guarantee at all.
It was even perfectly possible that all our hard\nwork would be for nothing.
'...Aah, I see. There's no guarantee that we'll\nbe successful.'
Kanako looked disappointed.
'But the whole point of this club is to dream,\nright? Although I don't really understand that\npoint of view myself.'
'No, Yoru. The point of this club is to dream,\nand also to make it happen.'
We weren't gathering together just to dream.
We were gathered to dream, and to make our dream\ncome true.
There was no solid form, power, authority, or\nreward.
It was just a vague dream, an obscure goal...
'This is youth!'
We were simply working, as if in a fever, towards\nour goal of 'the sky.
'It really is done.'
'Wow, I heard you'd finished it, but I hadn't\nrealized how much progress you've made.'
'Huh? What are those two doing here?'
Akari and Ma-bou had arrived.
'We just here to observe. Since this club is off\ncampus, someone has to come and check on you now\nand then, right?'
'She says that, but really Akari's just wondering\nhow her favorite Soaring Club is doing.'
'Sorry...'
'I see someone else really cares about this.'
'...It seems so.'
The sky that our senpai dreamed about.
The sky that we were chasing now.
Our summer was finally brought to a close.
We'd come to a good stopping place, so we decided\nto finish club early.
So I invited Asa to Windy's. Since we had some\nextra time, I thought we could go on a date on\nthe way home.
'I guess this is our first date.'
'Hee hee! That's right.'

We'd only been dating for a few days, and we'd
been so busy with our club the whole time that I
hadn't even had time to so much as go shopping
with her.
So today was our first date.
'Where would you like to go?'
'Honestly I don't care at all. Is there anywhere\nyou'd like to go, Asa?'
'I don't really have a place in mind either... I\ndon't have any errands to do or anything...'
'I see. Well then, let's just wander around and\nlook at various shops.'
'Okay, let's do that.'
We'd choose a shop at random and go inside, poke\naround for a while, and leave again.
'Oh, a dog, a dog! Look, Aoi! It's so cute!'
'Oh yeah, you like dogs. And Yoru likes cats...'
'We argue about it when we're together.'
Asa was very expressive, and was constantly\nreacting to everything around us, so it was fun\nto be with her.
'A rice-cooking vacuum cleaner...?'
'Wow, this vacuum has an amazing feature, Aoi! It\nuses the heat produced while cleaning to cook\nrice!'
'...I definitely wouldn't want to eat that. And\nwould you have to keep vacuuming the entire time\nthe rice was cooking? Wouldn't that be noisy?'
'But it's so ambitious, don't you think?'
As we wandered around the shops, we could each\nsee what the other was interested in, and came to\nunderstand each other even more.
I already knew it, but Asa had really bad taste.
'Drooly Dog'...'
'It's a local mascot character. Wow, this dog is\nreally drooling! It says it likes girls in\nminiskirts.'
'This thing's mere existence is a form of sexual\nharrassment. Isn't that face ridiculous?'
'But its creepiness is part of its charm. I feel\nlike it brings out the maternal instinct in\npeople.'
'Eh? Asa, are you serious?'
'I love that it's not cute at all... The longer I\nlook at the drool, the more charming it seems...'
Hmmm, I don't understand Asa that well after all.
But I suppose her mysteriousness was part of her\ncharm as well.
We looked at clothing stores, gift shops, stone\nmarkets, CD shops, and more.
Asa and I wandered all over together.
'Ah, can we stop at a bookstore for a minute? The\nnewest volume in a series I'm collecting just\ncame out.'
'Now that you mention it, there's one I want to\npick up too.'
I'm pretty sure it was supposed to come out\naround the beginning of this month.
I kept planning to buy it, but hadn't gotten\naround to it.
'What kind of books do you usually read? I saw a\nlot of comics in your room.'

'That's right. I've started reading a lot since I
came back here. I like a lot of different stuff,
but my favorites are action stories or... I guess
comics about bicycles?'
I answered her as I picked up the newest volume\nof a bike comic.
There were a lot of comics about bicycles\nrecently, which made me kind of happy.
'You're like a typical guy with a little\nspecialization.'
'What's that supposed to mean? Anyway, what books\ndo you like?'
'I like kind of dark stories.'
Asa picked up a zombie book in the boys' comics\nsection.
...That was an unexpected choice.
'I like stories about human despair and\ndesperation.'
'...I, I see.'
She was so mysterious...
'Yup. Oh, can I go to your room tonight? I'd like\nto read the comics you like.'
'Hm? You want to come to my room? I don't mind\nbut... It's a guy's room, you know, so it's\ndirty.'
'I've been in there before.'
Oh yeah, she'd been living there when I first\ncame.
Yoru had talked about it being dirty or\nsomething.
'Well, it's fine with me. I'll try to clean it up\na bit.'
'Yay! I'm looking forward to it.'
'Here you are.'
'Wow, thanks!'
I bought Hargen Darch ice cream for both of us\nwhile Asa rested on a bench.
I passed her super-spicy Szechuan vanilla, her\nfavorite flavor.
I just had a normal strawberry one for myself.
'...Mmm... I love the bright cheerful sweetness\nhidden in this spice! It's so good! Thank you so\nmuch, Aoi!'
'...You really do like rather strange things,\ndon't you, Asa?'
'Hm? Really?'
'Yeah.'
She really was very strange.
'...Do you... not like girls... with weird\ntastes?'
'I've never thought that for a second. Don't\nworry about it.'
'Thank goodness. That's a relief.'
'In fact I think it's cute. If you ever told me\nyou didn't like spicy stuff, I might stop liking\nyou.'
'Whaaa?! W, Well then, I'll make sure I stay the\nsame and keep liking spicy things!'
'Ahaha! Yeah, you're definitely cute, Asa.'
'Hee hee hee...'
She was so cute!
She tried to hide her blushing face with her ice\ncream cup as she ate.
All her little habits and gestures were just...
'...So cute, Asa.'
'Uh... Ummm, when you tell me that so many times,\nit's kind of embarrassing! But I'm happy...'
'Well, you know when you see a really cute animal\nor something, you can't help just saying how cute\nit is? It's... It's kind of like that...'
'You think I'm like an animal?!'
'N...no, that's not what I meant...'
'Then what?! What do you mean?!'
Asa started hitting me repeatedly in the chest.
And that was cute too.
'Hm? What is it?'
'You've got some ice cream on your face, Asa.'
'Huh?'
I reached out towards Asa's lips.
I wiped the ice cream off with my finger, and\nbrought it to my own mouth.
'Hmm... This ice cream really is a strange\nflavor.'
'What is it, Asa?'
'Uh, no, it's just...
'That was really embarrassing!'
I guess it was, now that I thought about it.
I just did it naturally...
'M...my turn!'
'Huh?!'
Asa scooped up some of my ice cream with her\nspoon and smeared it on my lip.
'Wait...!'
'Uh, umm... I'll get that for you!'
Then Asa wiped up the ice cream with her fingers\nand brought it to her mouth.
'...Yeah, it's strawberry.'
'...My turn.'
I didn't like to lose, so I scooped up Asa's ice\ncream with a spoon, and smeared it on Asa's face.
'Eek!'
'...Yup, it's still a weird flavor.'
'Aarrrgh... My turn! Ha!'
'M, my turn!'
'...Um, Asa?'
'What the heck are we doing?'
'Good question...'
There was one thing I could see.
All the people around us were staring at us with\ncold expressions.
Some even seemed filled with hatred, like they\nwere cursing us.
'...L, let's go home.'
'Good idea...'
'Today was fun, Aoi.'
'Glad to hear it. Good thing I asked you out,\nthen.'
'You really give me all sorts of things. It's so\nfun to be with you.'
'And with all the people in Soaring. They've all\ngiven me so much, so many important things, and\nshared their dream with me...'
'...But, is it really okay for you?'
'Huh? Is what okay?'
'I'm just a little uneasy. I just feel like I\nhaven't been able to give anything back to you.'
'I know what you said before, but I still feel\nlike I'm not as talented as you and the others.'
'You've done so much to comfort me, but...'
'Everyone in Soaring, too...'
'I've told you, it's fine. I chose you, Asa.'
'If you keep being so hard on yourself, I really\nmight stop liking you.'
'N, no! Please don't stop liking me!'
'Then have a little confidence in yourself. I\nlike you, Asa. I think everyone else likes you\ntoo. And of course Yoru does.'
'So it's okay. Got it?'
'Yes.'
'Waaaaaahhh!'
Hmm?
I suddenly heard a child crying.
'Over there.'
Asa found the source of the noise, and pointed it\nout to me.
When I looked, I saw a little boy crying his eyes\nout.
He looked about 6 or 8 years old.
'Maybe he's lost.'
'...I don't know.'
We couldn't just ignore him, though.
Asa and I walked over to the boy.
He must have been crying for quite a while. His\nnose was running badly.
'What's wrong?'
When we suddenly spoke to the boy, he looked\nstartled and confused.
'Ah, um, sorry. You were crying, so, uh, yeah?'
'... I can't do a backwards flip on the bars.'
'A backwards flip?'
The boy's eyes were still full of tears as he\nspoke.
'...I practiced, but I can't do it.'
'You practiced?'
'There's a little park in the residential area\nhere. Is that where you were?'
The boy nodded.
'I see... Then why are you crying here?'
'Hmm?'
The boy came closer.
He buried his face in my stomach, grabbed onto my\nuniform, and...
'Fnnnffthfffffftttthhh!'
'Heeeeeeey!'
It was the worst.
He blew his nose on my uniform.
'Uwaaaaaaaaaahhh!!'
And then he burst out crying.
'W, wait a minute!'
'Calm down, Aoi. He's just scared.'
Actually I felt like crying myself.
I had no clue what to do in this situation.
'I'm so sorry!'
Just as I stood wondering what to do, a woman\ncame running towards us, out of breath.
She was... In her late twenties, maybe? She\nlooked young and pretty.
'I'm sorry! This is my boy.'
'Ah... You're his mother?'
'Nnnnnngh... Waaaaaah!!'
The boy emerged from my shirt and ran towards his\nmother.
'There there, it's okay now. You don't want to\ncry out here where everyone can see you, do you?'
'Uuunnnnnhhh...'
He kept crying, trying to get his mother to hold\nhim.
'I'm sorry my boy was bothering you... Oh, oh\nno!!'
'I...I'm so sorry! He got snot all over your\nclothes! My son did that, right? I'm so sorry!'
'Ah, no, no, don't worry about it...'
The woman pulled a handkerchief from her bag and\nwiped the snot from my clothes.
Well, it wasn't too dirty, so I wasn't that upset\nabout it.
'My boy was practicing backwards flips in the\npark... But no matter how many times he tried, he\ncouldn't do it.'
'All the kids he knows can already do it. So... I\nguess he must have been really upset. He started\ncrying and ran all the way here...'
'I see.'
'He really is a crybaby...'
He must have just run out of patience.
'I really am sorry. Umm, shall I take your\nclothes to the cleaners...?'
'Ah, no, it's my uniform, so you don't have to do\nthat!'
'Oh, that's right. I can't take it away from\nyou.'
'Then, can I offer you something...?'
'No, it's really okay. You don't have to worry!'
She must be a really good person.
But he honestly hadn't caused much of a problem\nat all, so I'd feel bad if she gave me something.
'I appreciate the thought, but it really wasn't a\nproblem. Thanks so much, though.'
'... A, Alright. I promise I won't forget this.'
She was really making too big a deal out of\nthis...
'Uuunnnnhh...'
The boy was still crying, wanting to be held.
'Hey there.'
Asa started talking to the little boy.
His crying quieted down a bit, and he turned to\nface her.
'It's okay. If you practice, I'm sure you'll\nlearn to do it.'
'It's okay.'
His voice was still quavering, but he answered.
'Thank you for comforting him.'
'No, it's just that I'm a crybaby too, so I\nwanted him to feel better.'
With that, Asa came back to my side and took my\nhand.
'Well, Aoi, shall we go now? It looks like this\nis all settled.'
'Yeah, seems that way.'
'Bye bye!'
Asa waved goodbye to the little boy.
He waved his hand just a little in response.
'Well then, I guess we'll be off.'
'Thank you so much!'
We nodded our heads to the mother, and started\nwalking home.
'A crybaby...'
'Hmm?'
'I guess that does come up from time to time.'
'What does?'
'...If it does come up, I'll tell you.'
'What are you talking about?'
'Hee hee, it's a secret until then!'
'Good evening! I've come to visit, just as\npromised!'
'Oh, welcome, Asa! Come on in!'
'Well then... I will.'
Just as we'd discussed, Asa came to my room to\nvisit.
'It's not too messy today, I see.'
'I told you I'd clean up first. I really worked\nat it.'
'Ahaha, I see!'
'My comics are over on that bookshelf. By the\nway, where's Yoru?'
'She's already asleep. Yoru's been training more\nin the mornings lately, so she sleeps a lot at\nnight.'
'...Training?'
'Oh, you didn't know? Yoru goes jogging and lifts\nweights and stuff in the mornings.'
'Huh? Yoru does stuff like that?'
'Yes. I used to do it with her, but... She told\nme to stop copying her, so I stopped.'
'...What time does she get up?'
'About 5:30, I think... She's always asleep\nbefore midnight.'
Wow. How healthy...
'I think she sleeps about six hours a night. But\nlately it's been more like seven.'
Yoru really does have an admirable lifestyle...
'B...but, what is she training for?'
'Everything is a step towards a goal for Yoru.'
'Huh? And what is her goal?'
'Even her goals are just steps towards larger\ngoals, she says.'
'That sounds deep... But I don't understand it at\nall...'
A goal is a step, and a step is a goal...?
'If you're wondering, you should ask her about it\nyourself. ...But you'd better not have an\naffair!'
'I wouldn't cheat on you.'
Well, I already knew that Yoru was an amazing\nperson.
'Well then, I'll check out your books, okay?'
'Yeah, go ahead.'
Asa gazed at my books for a while.
Then she took one of them off the shelf.
'Do you read boys' comics, Asa?'
'Yes. I like all sorts of genres, for both comics\nand novels.'
'Hmm... You really like books, don't you?'

'That's a little gloomy...'
'But you've got a lot of horror comics here too.\nYou've even got an urban legend encyclopedia and\nbooks of real life ghost stories.'

'Oh yeah, those were already in this room when I
got here. They belonged to the person who lived
here before me, but I was told I could keep
them...'
I couldn't bring myself to just throw them away,\nso I lined them up on my bookshelf.
'I'm jealous! I've been wanting to buy a lot of\nthese but just couldn't afford them.'
Wow, I hadn't known that.
'In that case, do you wanna take them with you?\nYou can have them, Asa.'
'Really? I'd be happy to get any books I haven't\nread yet.'

'Sure. That whole section is books I was given,
so go ahead and look through them and take
whatever you want. Also, if you want to read any
of those other ones, I'll lend them to you.'
'Yay! Thanks so much, Aoi!'
Asa looked excitedly through the comic books.
She took a few of them off the shelf, and then...
'Can I borrow your bed, Aoi?'
'Huh? My bed?'
Slump.
She flopped down on my bed and started reading.
'I like relaxing like this when I read comics.'
'I understand. It feels so self-indulgent. I get\nthat, but...'
I get it, but, I can't believe she just came to a\nguy's room and laid down on the bed.
Even for a couple, that just seemed awfully\nrisky.
'But?'
'...No, nothing.'
'Huh? You're strange.'
But if I said it out loud it would mean I've been\nthinking about those things.
Yea. I should leave it at that.

'I used to collect this manga. I'm glad you have
the later volumes. It's an old series, so they
don't have it in the bookstores anymore, and it's

I didn't know it's true value but, it appears\nthey are quite expensive now.

'...(reading)'

'...(reading)'
'...(reading)'

And then what if she gets mad at me for not\nsaying anything?

...no I want to avoid that!

'N...no, not at all. In fact it was quite\nnice...'

'Ah, yeah, umm, err...'
'That's right, I had just finished reading this!\nLet me go look for another book!'
'Yea, do that!'
She said as she got up in a hurry and went for\nthe bookshelf to retun the one she was reading.
'Um, yes, I'll read this one now! This one looks\ninteresting! It looks really scary!'
And retrieved a new volume from the horror\nsection. The cover was a grotesque image.
It's from deep within the horror section, a book\ncover that normal people wouldn't bother to pick\nup, that B6 sized book..

Asa was looking through that,
'Porn book.
